lines.text: And why should the people listen to you?
Because, unlike some other Robin Hoods, I can speak with an English accent.
Prince of Thieves, in which Kevin Costner played the role with an American accent]
Blinkin, listen to me. They've taken the castle!
I thought it felt a bit drafty. Cor, this never would have happened if your father was alive.
He's dead?
Yes...
And my mother?
She died of pneumonia while...
[Remembers]
Oh, you were away!
My brothers?
There were all killed by the plague.
My dog, Pongo?
Run over by a carriage.
My goldfish, Goldie?
Eaten by the cat.

[on the verge of tears]
My cat?
Choked on the goldfish.
[pause]
Oh, it's good to be home, ain't it, Master Robin?
As my first order of business, I would like to appoint a new Sheriff... my friend Ahchoo.
A black sheriff?
He's black?
And why not? It worked in Blazing Saddles.
I lost. I lost? Wait a second, I'm not supposed to lose. Let me see the script.

[singing]
We're men / We're men in tights / We roam around the forest looking for fights / We're men / We're men in tights / We rob from the rich and give to the poor / That's right! / We may look like sissies / But watch what you say / Or else we'll put out your lights / We're men / We're men in tights / Always on guard / Defending the people's rights / We're men / Manly men! / We're men in tights / Yes! / We roam around the forest looking for fights / We're men / We're men in tights / We rob from the rich and give to the poor / That's right! / We may look like pansies / But don't get us wrong / Or else we'll put out your lights / We're men / We're men in tights / *Tight tights* / Always on guard / Defending the people's rights / When you're in a fix / Just call for the men in tights / We're butch!
Oh Master Robin!
[hugging a replica statue of the Venus de Milo]
You lost your arms in battle! But you grew some nice boobs.
Blinkin, I'm over here.
Such an unusual name, "Latrine." How did your family come by it?
We changed it in the 9th century.
You mean you changed it TO "Latrine"?
Yeah. Used to be "Shithouse."
It's a good change. That's a good change!
Blinkin, I'd like you to meet Ahchoo.
A Jew? Here?
No no, not a Jew. Ahchoo.
Excuse me, King. Why, if you like this guy so much, do you object to his marrying Maid Marian?
I have no objection, but I have not yet kissed the bride. It is a custom, and my royal right.
[hands the rabbi his sword]
Hold this, Father.
Rabbi.
Whatever.
[tilts Maid Marian and gives her a very long kiss]

[impressed]
It's good to be the king.
Now...
[voice squeaking]
*you* may marry them!
Thank you. Here's your knife.
Sword.
Whatever.
You are entering the territory of Robin Hood and his Merry Men.
Faygeles?
[clears their throats, trying to act macho]
No, no. We're straight. Just... merry.
As I. And who are you, with the exceptionally long feather in your hat?
I am Robin of Loxley.

Robin of Loxley? I've just come from Maid Marian, the woman whose heart you've stolen, you prince of thieves, you! I knew her parents before they were taken in the plague, Lord and Lady Bahgel. You know, you two were made for each other. I mean, what a combination. Loxley and Bahgel! It can't miss!

[taking off his leather glove and slapping Robin with it]
I challenge you to a duel.

[picking an iron gauntlet up from the dinner table and smacking Rottingham across the face with it, knocking him down]
I accept!
Hey Blinkin.
Did you say 'Abe Lincoln'?
No, I didn't say 'Abe Lincoln', I said 'Hey Blinkin.' Hold the reins, man.
Too-ta-loo. Au revior. Auf weidesen. Ciao. Ding dow dai.
[Blinkin, the blind man, is up in a perch looking out for strangers]
Blinkin! What are you doing?
Guessing. I guess no one's coming.
[Robin tries to jump on his horse and falls]
Man, white men can't jump.

[taking Prince John's crown]
You are no longer worthy to wear this sacred symbol of authority.
Oh please have mercy on me, brother. It wasn't my fault. I got some really bad advice from Rottingham.

[coughs]
Bullshit! Bullshit!
Brother, you have surrounded your given name with a foul stench!
[to the crowd]
From this day forth, all the toilets in the kingdom shall be known as... johns!
[cheers]
NOOOOOOOOOOO!
Take him away! Put him in the Tower of London! Make him part of the tour.
This was to be a "private" meeting... I mean, who are these men?
These? These are my most trusted associates. On my right, Dirty Ezio. On my left, Filthy Luca.

[Stands Up]
We thank you, for inviting us on the day of your daughter's wedding.
No, no, no.
I hope that her first child, is a masculine child.
Shut up! We haven't even had our meeting yet!
...Oh yeah.
[sits down]

[after Blinkin catches an arrow]
Blinkin! How did you do that?
I heard that coming a mile away.
Right-o, Blinkin, very good.
Pardon? Who's talking?
Will Scarlet.
Scarlet's my middle name. My full name is Will Scarlet O'Hara.
[pause]
We're from Georgia.

[Imitating Lou Costello]
He-e-y Abbot!
I hate that guy!
I've come to warn you, Prince John and Rottingham have hired men to kill you at the fair tomorrow. You musn't go.
Well, that's easy. I won't.
Oh, I'm so happy! They were going to try to lure you there by having an archery contest.
An archery contest?
Their archer is unbeatable.
Really?
Robin, promise you won't go.
All right, I promise you won't go.
Thank you.
[stops for a second, confused]
But wait a minute, Robin, didn't you just...
Cool it...
Chilled.
Let's face it. You've gotta be a man to wear tights!
[Robin and Ahchoo are fighting royal soldiers]
Time out! Sorry bad guys, but I am running out of air. Gotta get pumped.
[Ahchoo pumps his sneakers]
OK honkies. Time in!

[trying to unlock the chastity belt]
Um, darling?

[in sultry voice]
What?
You're not going to believe this...
What?
It won't open!
WHAT?
Wait, I have an idea! Call a locksmith!
[preparing to ravish Maid Marian]
A chastity belt! That's going to chafe my willy!
And who might you be?
Oh, they call me Little John. But don't let my name fool you. In real life, I'm very big.
I'll take your word for it.
[Ahchoo has released Robin from a noose]
Nice shooting, Ahchoo.
To tell you the truth, I was aiming for the Hangman.
I am Rabbi Tuckman, purveyor of sacramental wine and moyel extraordinaire.
'ello Rabbi!
Hello boys!
A moyel... I don't believe I've ever heard of that profession.
A moyel is a very important guy. He makes circumcisions.
What, pray tell, sir, is a circumcision?
It's the latest craze. The ladies love it!
I'll take one!
Hey, put me down for two!
I'm game. How's it done?
It's a snap.
[demonstrates with a carrot and a miniature guillotine]
I take my machine here, I take your little thing, I put it through this hole, and then...
[releases the blade, cutting the end off the carrot]
I nip the tip! Whose first?
[groan]
I changed me mind!
I forgot, I already got one.

[puts his hand in the air]
Question...
[Ahchoo pulls his arm down silencing him]
I gotta start working with a younger crowd.

[first meeting Blinkin the blind servant]
BLINKIN!
Master Robin, Is that you?
Yes.
What back from the Crusades?
Yes.
And alive?

[pause]
yes.
There must be another way of doing the credits.
That's right. Every time they make a Robin Hood movie, they burn our village down!
Wasn't your... didn't your mole used to be on the other side?
I have a MOLE?

[rushes into Le Dungeon]
I just told my boss the good news and...
[sees that all the prisoners has escaped]
and... and I'm in deep shit!
[Robin crashes Prince John's party, and slams a wild pig on the table]
That's a wild boar!
No, no. That's a wild pig.
[Robin points at Prince John]
*That's* a wild bore.
Prepare for the fight scene!
King illegal forest to pig wild kill in it a is!
What?
I mean, don't you know it's illegal to kill a wild pig in the king's forest?
Is it not also illegal to sit on the king's throne and usurp his power in his absence?
[crowd gasps]
Careful Robin, you go too far.
Blinkin! Fix your boobs; you look like a bleedin' Picasso!
We are here to witness the marriage, of Mervin, the Sheriff of...
[crowd snickers]
Mervin? Your name is Mervin?

[over crowd laughing]
Shut up! Shut up!
OK... Mervin.
[crowd starts laughing again]
The old man is Loxley.
Are you sure? He looks like Mark Twain.
Sire, I have news!

And what sort of news do you have? It's not bad news, is it? You know I can't take bad news. The day started out so good. I had a good night's sleep, I had a good B.M. I don't want to hear any bad news. So, what kind of news is it?
Well, to be perfectly frank, it's bad.

[shouts]
I knew it! I knew it would be bad news. Wait, I have an idea. Maybe if you tell me the *bad* news in a *good* way, it wouldn't sound so bad.

[thinking]
The bad news in a good way. Yes, I can do that. The bad news in a good way. Well, here it goes.
[hysterically]
W-wait till you hear this! I just saw Robin of Locksley, he's back from the crusades.
[laughs]
You know, he just beat the *crap* out of me and my men.
[laughs]
He hates you and he loves your brother, Richard!
[laughs]
And...
[laughs]
... he wants to see you hanged!
[laughs]
We, we're in a lot of trouble!
[laughs and snorts loudly]

[furious]
What, are you crazy? Why are you laughing? This is terrible news!

[Robin and Ahchoo are fight the sherif of Rottinghams men]
Watch my back!

[Ahchoo litarlly leans over and looks at his back as a guard punches him twice in the back]
Your back just got punched twice.
Thank You!
I will perform the opening prayer in the New Latin. Oh ordlay, ivethgay usway ouryay essingsblay. Amen-ay!
AMEN-AY!
Tell everyone that when the day is out we shall have a wedding. Or a hanging. Either way, we're gonna have a lot of fun, huh?
Over that boy hand!
[pauses, looking confused]
Hand over that boy!
LEAVE US ALONE, MEL BROOKS!
[after falling from a tree]
I can see!
[runs right into another tree]
Nope, I was wrong.
This is a stealth catapult, we've been working on it secretly for months. It can hurl one of these heavy boulders undetected, over a hundred yards, completely destroying anything in its path.
Wow! How's it work?
It's rather simple. You get one of these heavy boulders, put it here where I'm sitting, and then pull on that lever.
Like this?
[John pulls the lever and flings Mervin into the air]
AAAAAAAAAAAAAAGGGGGGGGGGGHHHHHHH!

[praying by her bed in her boudoir]
Oh dear Lord, if you see fit to send me my one true love...
[the Sheriff crashes through the roof and lands on the bed]

[looks up and grins]
Thank you!
[starts to climb on top of the Sheriff]
Oh my god! Oh my god!

[struggles]
No! No! I have a headache!
[runs away]
OH BUGGER!
[breaks the fourth wall]
I was *that* close! I touched it.
Good people, who have travelled from villages near and far! Lend me your ears!
[Crowd proceeds to pull off ears and throw them at Robin]
That's disgusting!
Robin of Loxley, where is your king?
King? King? And which King might that be? King Richard? King Louis? King Kong? Larry King?
"One day, he, who is destined for me, shall be endowed with a magical key, that will bring an end to my... virginity."
Oh, Marian, if only 'twere me.
Oh, if 'twere you, 'twould be... twerrific.

[performing the marriage]
Robin, do you?
I do.
Marian, do you?
I do.
I now pronounce you man and...
I object!
Who asked?
Struckey has loxed again.
What?
Loxley has struck again.
[Robin is being made to watch Marian's wedding from the gallows]
Do you, Sheriff of Rottingham, take Marian of Bahgel to be your lawfully wedded wife, to have and to hold, in sickness and in health, till death do you part?
YES I DO! Get on with it!
And do you, Marian, vow to do all the stuff I just said?

[to Marian]
Say I do, or Robin dies!
I... I do...
[Ahchoo shoots through Robin's noose]
NOT!
He "deered" to kill a King's dare.

[realizing he said it wrong]
He dared to kill a King's deer.
Kindly let me pass.
Uh, no. Sorry, but a toll is a toll, and a roll is a roll, and if we don't get no tolls, then we don't eat no rolls.
[Proudly]
I made that up.
It's very fascinating. But I'm afraid I'm going to have to hurt you.
A toll is a toll, and a roll is a roll. And if we don't get no tolls, then we don't eat no rolls. I made that up.
You know, this wasn't a very smart thing to do, Loxley. I'll pay for this!
[pause]
YOU'LL pay for this!
Let's get out of this ladies clothing and get into our tights!
Don Giovanni, if I may say so, your lizard looks limp.

[holding lizard]
Yeah, well, when you get to be my age... Oh! My lizard! Oh yeah!
Wait!
What for?
If you promise not to kill Robin, I shall do the most disgusting thing that I can think of.
Oooohhh.
Oh? And what's that?
I shall marry you.
What? You'll be mine? You'll give yourself to me every night? And sometimes, right after lunch?
Yes, but only my body. You can never have my heart, my mind, or my soul!
Oh, oh yes! I respect that.
This is Ahchoo.
Bless you!

[laughs]
No, that's my name, man. Ahchoo.
[Sheriff of Rottingham carries a screaming Maid Marian to a tower of his castle]

[to Robin]
The Sheriff! He's got your woman, man! He's gonna deflower her in the tower! Ugh!

[standing by a creek]
Look, Robin, you don't have to do this. I mean, this ain't exactly the Mississipi. I'm on one side, I'm on the other side. I'm on the east bank, I'm on the west bank. It's not that critical.
Robin is gonna be dead. D-E-D. Dead.
I will take these cotton balls from you with my hand and put them in my pocket.
I am Asneeze, father of Ahchoo.
Bless you.
No no no, Ahchoo is my son.

[offers to shake hands with Blinkin]
Hey, put her there?
How do you do do?
[extends arm that hits Achoo in the gut]

[hoarsely]
I've been better.
[Pre-movie Rap]

[rapping]
Yo, yo, yo!
Check it out!

Prince John and the Sherrif, they was runnin' the show/raisin' the taxes 'cause they needed the dough/a reign of terror took over the land/ they were shakin' down the people just to beat the band I said hey.
Hey!
I said hey!
Hey!
I said...
Hey nonny-nonny and a ho ho ho.
The people weren't happy, morale was low/ they had no place to turn to, there was nowhere to go/ they needed a hero, but no one could be found/ 'cause Robin Hood was out of town I said hey.
Hey!
I said hey!
Hey!
I said...
Hey nonny-nonny and a ho ho ho.
He was put into the slammer by his Arab foe/ and in a little while he would be no mo' I said hey!
Hey!
I said hey!
Hey!
I said...
Hey nonny-nonny. Hey nonny-nonny. Hey nonny-nonny and a whoa, whoa, who. Check it out.
Rabbi, you seem to be on the side of good. Will you come and share with us some of your wisdom, some of your council, and perhaps... some of your wine?
[Merry Men snicker]
Wisdom and council, that's easy. But this is sacrimental wine! It's only used to bless things.
Awwwww...

[pauses]
Wait a minute! There's things here! There's rocks, there's trees, there's birds, there's squirrels. Come on, we'll bless them all until we get vashnigyered
[drunk]
Join me!
Let's hear it for the Rabbi!
[Cheer]

[carrying Marian to the bed]
Oh my darling, at last.

[sliding his hand to the key to unlock her chastity belt]
Yes, yes, yes, yes, yes!

[rushes into the room]
NOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO!
[groans]
You are not married yet! Before you do it, you must go through it! Or else I blew it.
Oh, my darling, I'm ready for that kiss now.
But first, I must warn you. It could only be a kiss. For I am a virgin and could never... go all the way.
But...
Unless I were married. Or if a man pledged his endless love to me.
Yes...
Or if I knew that he desperately cared for me. Or if he were really cute!
By the by, do you know praying mantis?
You're looking at him.
What part of Georgia you from? South Central?
Hey man, tough room... why don't you let me give it a try.
[Puts on a pair of glasses]

People of Sherwood look at yourselves! Go ahead, take a look around. Oh people of Sherwood you been had. Hoodwinked! Bamboozled! Run amuck! We didn't land on Sherwood forest, Sherwood forest landed on us!
[Broomhilde prepares to jump on horse from the balcony]
[makes loud noise and shakes head]
She's got to be kidding!
[Villagers begin throwing food at the archery contest]
Oh good, they've opened the salad bar.
Send word to one and all, and all and one... that's a little redundant, isn't it?
WHAT?
Shut up!
No ding-ding vithout a vedding ring!
[Rottingham slices off Robin's necklace, sending his key flying. The key falls into the lock of Marian's chastity belt]
It is the key to the greatest treasure in all the land!
This means you've always been my one true love because it's just the right size!
It's not the size that counts... It's how you use it!
Oh Broomhilde, look! A happy little bluebird! Hello!
[the bird lands on her finger]
This means I must make a wish. I wish against wish, I hope against hope, that the heavens bring me a kind and wonderful gentleman who possesses the key to my...
[looks at her chastity belt, then looks at Broomhilde]
heart.
[bird flies away]
Goodbye, my little friend.
Ooh, that happy little bluebird has left a happy little do-do on your hand!
Rabbi!

[sticks his head out of his tent]
Who calls?
It is I, Robin of Loxley! We wish to get married in a hurry!
Married in a hurry? That's great! Hold on, I'm on my last customer. I'll be right out.
[goes back inside his tent, then something being chopped off is heard, followed by a man screaming. The rabbi comes back out]
Put a little ice on it. You'll be fine.
[to Robin]
Married in a hurry, married in a hurry! Please invite me to the briss.
Broomhilde, there's a foul plot afoot.
It's not my feet, I just washed them.
What can you tell me about Robin of Loxley?
Robin of Loxley? Robin of Loxley? Hmm, let me see.
[starts cooking up a potion in her cauldron]

Raven's egg! Blood of a hen! A little more blood, yes! Eyeballs of a crocodile! Testicles of a newt! I bet he's a transsexual now! Robin of Loxley is handsome and brave. He seeks to regain his family's honor. Little sod could be trouble.
Are you certain?
Certain? You want certain, hire yourself a witch! Me, I'm just your cook.
[serves contents of the cauldron]
Here, eat that.
I hope's it worth the NOISE!

[after Robin has fired his shot, hitting the bullseye dead center]
Don't worry, Dirty Ezio still has another shot.
But he hit the very center of the bullseye... schmuck!
I should have never worn these shoes. They just don't match my purse.
Blinkin - what's the fastest way to reach the villagers?
Why don't we fox them?
Fox them!
[Robin has just been chained in Le Dungeon]
You are very brave for not a homeboy.
Oh, thank you.
I've been in here for a while. Perhaps I could be of service. Do you have any questions?
What are you in for?
Jaywalking.
I hope she's still wearing her iron underwear.

[In a Jocular mood]
Let's see, are you about a 16, 16 1/2?
[mimics hanging himself, then hums as he selects a noose and places it around Robin's neck]
There.
It's a little tight.
That's the idea. Would you care for a blind fold?
[Robin shakes his head; the hangman raises his eyepatch]
How about half a one? Get it, sir?

[as Maid Marian walks down the stairs]
Lovely Bristols.
[Post-movie rap]

[rapping]
So that's our story and it worked out good/King Richard's on his throne and Robin's back in the hood/ so let's bid our friends a fine ado/and we'll hope to meet again in Robin Hood 2/ I said hey!
Hey!
I said hey!
Hey!
I said
Hey nonny-nonny. Hey nonny-nonny. Hey nonny-nonny and a-here we go.
Are you with me? Yea or Nay?
Well which one means yes?
Yea.
Save me, save me! Hurt them, hurt them!
Right! Save them, save them, hurt you, hurt you! I've got it!
I was angry at you before Loxley, but now I'm really pissed off!
Pissed off? If I was that close to a horse's wiener I'd be worrying about being pissed on!
Ah! Right rope!
[Ahchoo is getting beaten up by a group of soldiers and as Robin who is riding his horse searches for Ahchoo, he suddenly saw Ahchoo getting beaten up by a group of soldiers]
Ahchoo?
[the soldiers briefly stop beating Ahchoo and face Robin Hood]
Bless you!
[the soldiers continues to beat up Ahchoo]
Man, I hope someone is getting a video of this!
